intro: Biotia crenata, commonly known as the wavy biotia, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves with wavy edges, giving it its common name. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Biotia crenata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and riverbanks.
